channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter, broken swing, plastic chair discarded, 31st July
item.description:
Lots of rubbish at butterfield playground regularly, including a plastic chair which has been there for a month. reported multiple times and reports say “fixed” but still remains. swing also broken.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wordsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Baby in a basket (doll), 31st July
item.description:
Flytipling on daily basis now. Just keep picking up after them. No fines. Why does anyone bother paying for waste collection when flytipping is this easy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three mattresses, chest of drawers and an oven, 31st July
item.description:
Came home to find another collection of flytiped items - three double mattresses, chest of drawers and an oven. This is a weekly occurrence and frustrating. Please help us stop this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog loose in no dog zone chasing birds., 31st July
item.description:
The dog in this photo was loose in the no dog zone chasing birds and the owner was out of sight. The dog nearly caught a Greylag goose and the owner appeared and pretended not to know dogs were not allowed in that area. He has been caught doing this before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BMW abandoned, 31st July
item.description:
Another vehicle with no tax and no valid MOT has just been dumped in this parking area. Witnessed someone driving the vehicle in to dump it here the person looked extremely nervous when they saw we were watching. Vehicle could barely move and was stalling no tax since last year driven illegally probably involved in crime. Third vehicle in this area dumped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 269, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
